contentrichtext.text: {{Politics of Somaliland}} This is a '''list of Presidents of [[Somaliland]]''', a self-declared republic that is internationally recognized as an [[States and regions of Somalia|autonomous region]] of [[Somalia]].<ref>{{cite web | title = The Transitional Federal Charter of the Somali Republic | publisher = [[University of Pretoria]] | date = 2004-02-01 | url = http://www.chr.up.ac.za/hr_docs/countries/docs/charterfeb04.pdf | accessdate = 2010-02-02}} "The Somali Republic shall have the following boundaries. (a) North; Gulf of Aden. (b) North West; Djibouti. (c) West; Ethiopia. (d) South south-west; Kenya. (e) East; Indian Ocean."</ref><ref>{{cite news | title = No Winner Seen in Somalia's Battle With Chaos | publisher = New York Times | date = 2009-06-02 | url = http://www.nytimes.com/2009/06/02/world/africa/02somalia.html | accessdate = 2010-02-02 | first=Jeffrey | last=Gettleman}}</ref> The government of Somaliland regards itself as the successor state to [[British Somaliland]], which was independent for a few days in 1960 as the [[State of Somaliland]].<ref>{{cite news |title=Somaliland Marks Independence After 73 Years of British Rule |url=http://select.nytimes.com/gst/abstract.html?res=F00A10FB395A1A7A93C4AB178DD85F448685F9 |format=fee required |publisher=The New York Times |page=6 |date=1960-06-26 |accessdate=2008-06-20}}</ref><ref>{{cite news| url=http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/magazine-10740852 | work=BBC News | title=How Britain said farewell to its Empire | date=23 July 2010}}</ref> The President of Somaliland is an executive [[head of state]], also functioning as the [[head of government]]. There is no [[Prime Minister]]. ==Presidents of Somaliland (1991-Present)== (Dates in italics indicate ''de facto ''continuation of office) {| class="wikitable" style="font-size:85%;" |- align=left ! width="18%"|Tenure ! width=60|Portrait ! width="55%"|Incumbent ! width="10%"|[[#Affiliations|Affiliation]] ! width="15%"|Notes |- valign=top bgcolor="#ffffec" |<small>28 May 1991 to 16 May 1993|| ||'''[[Abdirahman Ahmed Ali Tuur]]''', <small>President||<small>SNM||<small> |- valign=top bgcolor="#ffffec" |<small>16 May 1993 to 3 May 2002|| ||'''[[Muhammad Haji Ibrahim Egal]]''', <small>President||<small>SNM/UDUB||<small>Died in office |- valign=top bgcolor="#ffffec" |<small>3 May 2002 to 27 July 2010|| ||'''[[Dahir Riyale Kahin]]''', <small>President||<small>UDUB||<small> |- valign=top bgcolor="#ffffec" |<small>27 July 2010 to Present||[[File:Ahmed Mohamed Mohamoud Silanyo - Chatham House 2010.jpg|60px]]||'''[[Ahmed Mahamoud Silanyo]]''', <small>President||<small>KULMIYE||<small> |} ==Affiliations== *[[Somali National Movement]] (SNM) *[[United Peoples' Democratic Party]] (UDUB) *[[Peace, Unity, and Development Party]] (KULMIYE) ==Latest election== {{Somaliland presidential election, 2010}} ==See also== *[[List of Presidents of Puntland]] *[[Lists of incumbents]] ==References== {{reflist}} {{Somaliland topics}} {{SMLPM}} {{Heads of state and government of African states}} [[Category:Lists of presidents|Somaliland, List of Presidents of]] [[Category:History of Somalia]] [[Category:Government of Somalia]] [[Category:Presidents of Somaliland| ]]
